section.paragraph: eZ is a global company with offices around the world including Skien (Norway), New York (USA), Oslo (Norway), Cologne (Germany), Paris (France), Lyon (France), Tokyo (Japan), Katowice (Poland)
Contact us for more information!

li.paragraph: Follow us on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn

section.paragraph: Copyright Â© 2014 eZ Systems AS (except where otherwise noted). All rights reserved.

paragraph.link: Building mobile browser and hybrid applications with eZ Publish

section.paragraph: If Create, Deliver and Optimize is the winning formula, the last thing you want to do when you are there is to automate so that your online user experience is self-building!

Identifying the right content, picking delivery strategy, understanding your metrics and optimizing your online presence to have your numbers on the up-side are tasks that requires a lot of work that no machine could do by itself. However, when you have identified the right recipes in that Create - Deliver - Optimize cycle, the next thing you want to do is automate as much as possible all the recurring tasks. That is where a platform like the eZ Publish Platform will deliver even more value, from Content sourcing and authoring to delivery workflow and marketing automation, relying on an integrated platform will help you automate the tasks that are taking your KPIs and your online business up!
photo byÂ winkyintheuk.
Content consumption is changing rapidly. An agile solution to distribute your content and empower your digital business model is key to success in every industry.

eZ Publish Enterprise is the platform to make the omni-channel approach possible. A powerful presentation engine provides a multiplicity of websites and pages that display your content in a variety of renderings. A powerful API directly and simply integrates your content with any Web-enabled application on any device, including the iPad, iPhone or Android without ever interfering with or impacting the platform itself.
photo by muneakiÂ (Creative CommonsÂ Attribution-Share Alike)
Increasing the productivity of your content infrastructure, eZ Publish Enterprise provides you with powerful tools to create, automate and collaborate on content...

Dealing with hundreds of editors, having millions of content contributions from different sources and managing information with dozens of audiences can get complex. You get a single tool to create content whatever the content type is. From very simple and unstructured to highly structured content with complex metadata and rich media. eZ Publish Enterprise enables your non-technical contributors to manage complex content infrastructures and to collaborate with co-workers to get tasks done quickly.
photo by Mzximvs VdB (cc Attribution-ShareAlike license)
Itâs about the right content at the right time and in the right format!

eZ Publish Enterprise offers an entire set of capabilities including search, analytics, personalized recommendations as well as automated and integrated testing functionality (e.g. A/B, Multivariate, etc.). Efficient search starts with enabling editors and letting them search for existing content to reuse and re-purpose. You can analyze the user behaviour, create a compelling content strategy and provide automated scenarios based on the users' behaviour.
photo by troy owens (Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License).

paragraph.line: Welcome to eZ Publish Platform 5.3, the Ventoux release.Â
This release brings several new features and general improvements on the foundations introduced in eZ Publish Platform 5

section.header: Key Selected New Features in eZ Publish 5
section.paragraph: Our objective is to provide you the most compelling Multichannel Web and Customer Experience Platform. With the eZ Publish 5 architecture we encompass a thoroughly revamped platform, which facilitates better user experiences, increases productivity, and enables your digital business model sustainably. Underlying and enabling these ambitious goals is a completely new but thoroughly backward compatible product architecture, along with a host of user interface (UI) enhancements.

li.paragraph: New Public API â Streamlined PHP Interface to eZ Publish
Enhanced REST API â eZ Publish as a Web Service
New high-performance framework for Web projects â Symfony full stack
New modern template engine â Twig based
Still totally backward compatible with 4.x legacy architecture

section.paragraph: For further information visit www.ez.no, the documentation: doc.ez.no and the share.ez.no community.
Image by MrBernardÂ (Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License)

Product Support is the core service of the eZ Publish Enterprise subscription, available to all our customers, with differing initial response times depending on the subscription service level.Â Subscribing to eZ Publish Enterprise gives you the option of requesting assistance from our product support team.
Product Support is the core service of the eZ Publish Enterprise subscription, available to all our customers, with differing initial response times depending on the subscription service level.

In addition to the available documentation and books, Enterprise subscribers have access to a highly professional support service which provides 3 tiers of support, escalation processes and both online and phone access.Â Our highly qualified, experienced product support teams are dedicated to the success of our customers. They ensure that your projects are successful and that you are totally satisfied with eZ. eZ is dedicated to helping and supporting both clients and partners. This is the core service of eZ's Enterprise Open Source Business model.

In addition to maintenance, you may want assistance from our professional services team to help manage your platform or assist with eZ Publish-based application development. With eZ Publish Enterprise, you are free to include extended services from our professional services staff. They are on-hand to help you implement and run your platform. Services differ depending on your region. They can include solution support tickets, regular audits, technical key accounting or training services.

No single solution is right for everyone, and just as one size does not fit all, you will discuss extended solution support with our sales engineer to define the specific package that fits your needs!
In the event that you need a one-time intervention, you have the flexibility to order specific professional services in addition to your service subscription at a momentâs notice.

section.header: Keep Your Platform Secure and Up-to-Date
section.paragraph: Subscribing to eZ Publish Enterprise gives you the option of requesting assistance from our product support team.

Subscribing to eZ Publish Enterprise gives you the option of requesting assistance from our product support team. In addition, eZ is constantly actively maintaining and assuring the quality of our software. With an eZ Publish Enterprise subscription, your installation will benefit from our quality assurance programs, which feature service packs to fix issues identified in the software as well as improve or enhance it in a variety of ways. eZ Publish Enterprise subscription is the best option for ensuring your eZ Publish platform is stable, reliable and continuously supported by our support services.

By subscribing to eZ Publish Enterprise, you benefit from an unique bug fix guarantee that cannot be obtained in any other way. eZ, as the maker of eZ Publish, deploys the necessary resources in order to fix the bugs you identify via the maintenance service.

If need be, and depending of the service level of your subscription, eZ will provide hot fixes - a rapid-response measure to workaround issues before the fix is even available in the maintenance service.
Photo: Martin Bekkelund, Friprogsenteret. CC Some rights reserved

eZ offersÂ Expert ConsultingÂ andÂ AuditsÂ via our Professional Services to help keep your eZ websites on-time, on-track and performing at peak levels. Our goal is that your implementation succeeds and that you get your message out on-time and on-budget.

eZ offers professional services to assist partners and/or clients with unusually complex situations that require specific project assistance. The scope is determined and customized prior to the time of engagement. Work can be performed remotely or on the client premises according to project needs.
Photo: Petri Mertanen

eZ Systems can offer your company the expert training you require to get the most out of eZ Publish. We have training scheduled in ourÂ regional offices, please check ourÂ Training Calendar. For groups of four or more, eZ can arrange training sessions that fit your schedule.Â

The eZ Publish essential training packages will help you get an easy introduction to the enterprise Content Management System eZ Publish.There are two target groups, technical skilled people like CMS beginners and de...

If you already have some experience with eZ Publish and want to get a deeper knowledge in special topics like enterprise search, website optimization, analytics or recommendations? You can select here from different s...

New eZ Publish version released ? If you need an overview of the new features and changes of a new eZ Publish version, simply book our update training and you will learn everything about the new version. You learn the...

If you have special topics which we did not mention in the categories above? We can design a training only for you. You define your interests and we prepare special training material matching your needs. Custom traini...

Participation in the eZ System Partner Program affords the ability to offer eZ training curriculum, add value to offerings, enhance training business and opens doors to the eZ's ecosystem of partners and customers, wh...
Most trainings are combined with the option of an online certification. eZ systems offers to perform an online exam with an automated tool.
Photo: Petri Mertanen
Joining the leading companies who subscribe to eZ Publish Enterprise brings a long list of benefits, services and tools designed to improve and secure your content platform.

eZ Publish Enterprise is the best choice for organizations employing eZ Publish in a professional environment. eZ Publish Enterprise comes with all the benefits of the open source eZ Publish community project, which is founded on innovative software created by eZ in collaboration with a global user base. The software is based on open standards, but packaged with a professional software and services package that is standardized, stable and solid. The Enterprise subscription includes support and bug fix guarantees, monitoring, and other value-added services.Â

Clear, concise intellectual property framework is another competitive advantage that sets eZ Publish Enterprise apart. Our customers are free to select the license that fits their business: either the traditional General Public License (GPL), or the professional Personal Use License (PUL). In either case, eZ Systems controls the intellectual property rights of the software, so thereâs no concern about conflicts of interest between software contributors.

section.header: Access to a dedicated Service Portal
section.paragraph: Your subscription to eZ Publish Enterprise entitles you to a dedicated Service Portal for communication and collaboration with our teams. In addition, you will receive secured extranet access for each service user for streamlined communication with eZ.

Important features of the Service Portal includes a support issue tracker, detailed summary of your subscription and its certified software, as well as access to maintenance and monitoring information.
Product Support is the core service of the eZ Publish Enterprise subscription, available to all our customers with differing initial response times depending on the subscription service level.
Copyright:Â QH Photography

section.paragraph: Mont VentouxÂ (VentorÂ in ProvenÃ§al) is a mountain in theÂ ProvenceÂ region of southernÂ France, located some 20Â km northeast ofÂ Carpentras,Â Vaucluse. On the north side, the mountain borders theÂ DrÃ´meÂ dÃ©partement. It is the largest mountain in the region and has been nicknamed the "Beast of Provence",Â the "Giant of Provence",Â or "The Bald Mountain".Â It has gained fame through its use in theÂ Tour de FranceÂ cycling race.
Download our white paper if you want to quickly discover eZ Publish 5.
This white paper contains

paragraph.strong: A detailed presentation of eZ Publish 5 for Marketers and Editors.
An introduction to the eZ Publish 5 technical architecture.
A clear summary of the value of using such a digital user experience management platform.

section.paragraph: Don't hesitate, leave us your contact information and download this paper to get all the benefits of eZ Publish 5.
Thanks for your interest, please download your copy of the white paper below.

Beyond Content Management, managing âDigital Experiencesâ, takes much more than technology; it is a strategy that focuses on the operations and processes of a business around the needs of the individual customer. Today leading organizations are increasingly focusing on building great experiences but realize it is a complex enterprise, involving strategy, integration of technology, orchestrating business models, brand management and CEO commitment.Â
Your opinion matter!
Ability to create your own Digital Experience is the key to a successful digital business! This is what eZ can help you with.
The Matterhorn, also known as Cervino was the second mountain codename used, it was in spring 2011 for the eZ Publish 4.5 release. Photo: cclÂ Some rights reserved by Frank Peters
eZ Publish 4.6 was named after the Annapurna mountainÂ (Sanskrit: âfull of foodâ). This was fall 2011. Photo:Â Some rights reserved by Sam@flickr
Stadda is almost there, the ".1" of the 5th generation: eZ Publish 5.1 and Norway's national mountain.
Latest summit on eZ's list, "le Ventoux", the "Giant of Provence" in spring 2014, a few weeks before le Tour de France. eZ Publish Platform 5.3 is here!
The first release of the new generation of eZ Publish, eZ Publish Â 5.0 platform, was Kilimanjaro. A giant for a giant step that happened in fall 2012.Â
The Etna release was the last of the 4.x generation, released in spring 2012.Â Photo byÂ Josep RenaliasÂ under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 2.5 Generic license.
Fuji is the first mountain eZ climbed, when releasing eZ Publish 4.4 in fall 2010.
eZ will climb Aconcagua in fall 2013, a very important release numbered eZ Publish Platform 5.2.Â Photo by Crystal Davis, World Resources Institute, 2007. Cc.
The mountains that eZ climbed.

Mount Fuji, located onÂ Honshu Island, is the highestÂ mountainÂ inÂ JapanÂ at 3,776.24Â m (12,389Â ft).Â AnÂ activeÂ stratovolcanoÂ that last erupted in 1707â08, Mount Fuji lies about 100 kilometres (60Â mi) south-west ofÂ Tokyo, and can be seen from there on a clear day. Mount Fuji's exceptionally symmetrical cone, which is snow-capped several months a year, is a well-known symbol of Japan and it is frequently depicted in art and photographs, as well as visited by sightseers and climbers. It is one of Japan's "Three Holy Mountains"Â along withÂ Mount TateÂ andÂ Mount Haku; it is aÂ Special Place of Scenic Beauty, aÂ Historic Site, and was added to theÂ World Heritage ListÂ as a Cultural Site on June 22nd, 2013.

paragraph.custom: This article uses material from the Wikipedia article Mount Fuji, which is released under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License.

section.paragraph: TheÂ MatterhornÂ (German),Â Monte CervinoÂ (Italian) orÂ Mont CervinÂ (French), is a mountain in theÂ Pennine AlpsÂ on the border betweenÂ SwitzerlandÂ andÂ Italy. Its summit is 4,478 metres (14,692Â ft) high, making it one of the highest peaks in theÂ Alps.Â The four steep faces, rising above the surrounding glaciers, face the four compass points. The mountain overlooks the town ofÂ ZermattÂ in the canton ofÂ ValaisÂ to the north-east andÂ Breuil-CerviniaÂ in theÂ Aosta ValleyÂ to the south.Â Theodul Pass, located at the eastern base of the peak, is the lowest passage between its north and south side.

paragraph.custom: This article uses material from the Wikipedia articleÂ Matterhorn, which is released under theÂ Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License.

section.paragraph: AnnapurnaÂ (Sanskrit,Â Nepali,Â Nepal Bhasa: à¤ à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤£) is a section of theÂ HimalayasÂ in north-centralÂ NepalÂ that includes 8,091Â m (26,545Â ft) Annapurna I, thirteen additional peaks over 7,000 m (22,970Â ft) and 16 more over 6,000 m (19,690Â ft).Â This section is a 55Â km-long (34Â mi-long)Â massifÂ bounded by theÂ Kali Gandaki GorgeÂ on the west, theÂ MarshyangdiÂ River on the north and east, andÂ Pokhara ValleyÂ on the south. Annapurna I is tenth among Earth's fourteenÂ eight-thousanders. 8167 metreÂ DhaulagiriÂ I rises 34Â km to the west across theÂ Kali Gandaki Gorge, considered Earth's deepest canyon.

paragraph.custom: This article uses material from the Wikipedia articleÂ Annapurna, which is released under theÂ Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License.

section.paragraph: Mount EtnaÂ (Latin:Â Aetna, Sicilian:Â MungibedduÂ orÂ 'a Muntagna) is an activeÂ stratovolcanoÂ on the east coast ofÂ Sicily,Â Italy, close toÂ MessinaÂ andÂ Catania. It lies above the convergent plate margin between theÂ African PlateÂ and theÂ Eurasian Plate. It is the tallest active volcano on theÂ EuropeanÂ continent, currently 3,329Â m (10,922Â ft) high, though this varies with summit eruptions. It is the highest mountain in Italy south of theÂ Alps. Etna covers an area of 1,190Â km2Â (459Â sqÂ mi) with a basal circumference of 140Â km. This makes it by far the largest of the threeÂ active volcanoes in Italy, being about two and a half times the height of the next largest,Â Mount Vesuvius. OnlyÂ Mount TeideÂ inÂ TenerifeÂ surpasses it in the whole of the EuropeanâNorth-African region.Â In Greek Mythology, the deadly monsterÂ TyphonÂ was trapped under this mountain byÂ Zeus, the god of the sky and thunder and king of gods, and the forges ofÂ HephaestusÂ were said to also be located underneath it.

paragraph.custom: This article uses material from the Wikipedia articleÂ Mount Etna, which is released under theÂ Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License.

section.paragraph: Mount Kilimanjaro, with its threeÂ volcanic cones,Â Kibo,Â Mawenzi, andÂ Shira, is a dormant volcanic mountain inÂ Tanzania. It is the highest mountain inÂ AfricaÂ and the highest free-standing mountain in theÂ worldÂ at 5,895 metres or 19,341 feet abovesea levelÂ (theÂ Uhuru Peak/Kibo Peak).

paragraph.custom: This article uses material from the Wikipedia articleÂ Mount Kilimanjaro, which is released under theÂ Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License.

section.paragraph: Stadda (inÂ Lule Sami:Â StÃ¡dda) is a mountain in the municipality ofÂ TysfjordÂ inÂ NordlandÂ county,Â Norway. It is located about 15 kilometres (9Â mi) northeast of the village ofÂ KjÃ¸psvik. The mountain has very smooth sides reaching all the way to theÂ fjord. Stetind has anÂ obelisk-shape which gives it a very distinct look. In 2002 it was voted to be the "National Mountain" of Norway by listeners ofÂ NRK.

paragraph.custom: This article uses material from the Wikipedia articleÂ Mount Stetind, which is released under theÂ Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License.

section.paragraph: AconcaguaÂ (Spanish pronunciation:Â [akoÅËkaÉ£wa]) is theÂ highest mountainÂ in theÂ WesternÂ andÂ Southern HemispheresÂ at 6,960.8 metres (22,837Â ft).Â It is located in theÂ AndesÂ mountain range, in theÂ provinceÂ ofÂ Mendoza,Â Argentina, and lies 112 kilometres (70Â mi) northwest of its capital, the city of Mendoza. The summit is also located about 5 kilometres from San Juan Province and 15 kilometres from the international border withÂ Chile. Aconcagua is the highest peak in both theÂ WesternÂ andÂ Southern Hemispheres. It is one of theÂ Seven Summits.

paragraph.custom: This article uses material from the Wikipedia articleÂ Aconcagua, which is released under theÂ Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License.

section.paragraph: Mont VentouxÂ (VentorÂ in ProvenÃ§al) is a mountain in theÂ ProvenceÂ region of southernÂ France, located some 20Â km northeast ofÂ Carpentras,Â Vaucluse. On the north side, the mountain borders theÂ DrÃ´meÂ dÃ©partement. It is the largest mountain in the region and has been nicknamed the "Beast of Provence",Â the "Giant of Provence",Â or "The Bald Mountain".Â It has gained fame through its use in theÂ Tour de FranceÂ cycling race.

paragraph.custom: This article uses material from the Wikipedia article Mount Ventoux, which is released under theÂ Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License.
